text: 2. The integers F, = 22" + 1 are called Fermat Numbers. Fermat conjectures that these integers are primes. Indeed, the first few Fermat numbers are primes, namely Fo =3, Fi =5, F» = 17, F3 = 257, and Fy = 65,537 and these are all prime numbers. However F=2"+1 is divisible by 641 and is not prime! Show that every composite Fermat number F,, = 2¥" +1 is a pseudoprime to the base 2. (3 pts)
